definition: wait and see (who is right)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit

sentences.english: Whether I'll be good at it is another thing.
sentences.chinese: 能不能干好是另一回事，我们走着瞧。

sentences.english: At Chelsea, there is a new cycle happening so we will see what happens.
sentences.chinese: 在切尔西，又将有一个新的循环，我们走着瞧。

definition: you got me!/you win!/you are something!
bring it on!/who's afraid?/who cares?
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
in your dreams!/as if!/You wish!/I wish that were so
lit. not to shed a tear until one sees the coffin (idiom)/fig. refuse to be convinced until one is faced with grim reality
pinyin: bu4 jian4 guan1 cai5 bu4 luo4 lei4

definition: the best part of the show is yet to come/(with ironic tone) the worst is yet to come/you ain't seen nothin' yet
pinyin: hao3 xi4 hai2 zai4 hou4 tou5

definition: to refuse a toast only to be forced to drink a forfeit/fig. to hesitate to do sth until forced to do even more
pinyin: jing4 jiu3 bu4 chi1 chi1 fa2 jiu3

definition: if only it were so/I hope so (idiom)
to admit defeat
bring it on!/give me all you got!
lit. for a nobleman to take revenge, ten years is not too long (idiom)/fig. revenge is a dish best served cold
pinyin: jun1 zi5 bao4 chou2 , shi2 nian2 bu4 wan3

definition: let's talk about the unpleasant things first/let's be frank
pinyin: chou3 hua4 shuo1 zai4 qian2 tou5

definition: to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
(idiom) it's a deal/that's settled then
